title: Add standalone CLI
description:
The portfolio philosophy is that tools should work both as CLI and as plugin — not just one or the other. Z Spec is currently plugin-only. A standalone CLI wrapping fuzz and probcli with the plugin's ProB compatibility rules would be useful independently of Claude Code.

Minimum CLI surface:
- z-spec check <file> — type-check with fuzz
- z-spec test <file> — animate/model-check with probcli
- z-spec doctor — verify dependencies (see related bead)

The CLI would apply the same ProB compatibility transforms (ZBOOL, bounded integers, flat schemas) that the plugin commands encode in their prompts, but as deterministic code.

title: Add doctor command
description:
Biff, Quarry, and LangLearn TTS all have doctor commands that verify installation health. Z Spec depends on fuzz (compiled from source) and probcli (platform-specific binary with Tcl/Tk dependency) — exactly the kind of dependencies that break.

Add a /z doctor command (or extend /z setup) that reports pass/fail for:
- fuzz binary found and executable
- fuzz.sty installed for LaTeX
- probcli binary found and executable
- Tcl/Tk libraries available for probcli

title: Add version to plugin.json
description:
plugin.json is missing the version field. All other plugins declare a version:
- PR/FAQ: 1.0.0
- Biff: 0.3.0
- Dungeon: 0.1.0

Add version field to plugin.json for consistency.

title: Add curl | bash installer
description:
Z Spec is the only plugin with no install path. Every other plugin (PR/FAQ, Biff, Dungeon) has a curl | bash installer that clones to ~/.claude/plugins/local-plugins/plugins/, registers in marketplace.json, and verifies dependencies.

Pattern to follow: prfaq/install.sh or claude-dungeon/install.sh.

The installer should:
1. Clone the repo to ~/.claude/plugins/local-plugins/plugins/z-spec
2. Register in marketplace.json
3. Check for fuzz and probcli (or prompt to run /z setup)
4. Clear plugin cache

title: Integrate Quarry for domain knowledge during spec generation
description:
PR/FAQ already uses Quarry as an optional dependency to enhance its research phase. Z Spec should do the same — when Quarry is installed, commands like /z create and /z code2model could search the user's indexed documents for domain knowledge (requirements docs, design docs, API specs, prior specifications) to produce more accurate Z specifications.

Use case: a user has indexed their project's design documentation, API contracts, and requirements in Quarry. When they run /z create, the plugin searches Quarry for relevant domain context before generating the spec. This helps produce specifications that use correct domain terminology, capture real invariants, and reflect actual business rules rather than guessing from code alone.

Similarly, /z elaborate could pull narrative from indexed design docs rather than requiring the user to point at specific files.

Pattern to follow: PR/FAQ's researcher agent checks for Quarry MCP tools and uses search_documents when available, falling back gracefully when Quarry is not installed.
